title: #426: The Random Show: Boozy Quarantine Edition!
description:
#426: The Random Show: Boozy Quarantine Edition! | Brought to you by Magic Spoon Cereal and â€œ5-Bullet Friday"

Technologist, serial entrepreneur, world-class investor, self-experimenter, and all-around wild and crazy guy Kevin Rose (@KevinRose),  rejoins me for another episode of "The Random Show." In this one we explore fine (and not-so-fine) wines, dog adoption, great fiction and non-fiction reads, anniversary celebration during quarantine, exotic meats and decadent desserts, skiing accidents, and much more.

Please enjoy!

NOTE: This episode was recorded on April 2nd on Caffeine.tv. Thanks to everyone who joined this special live edition! ğŸ™

This episode is brought to you by Magic Spoon Cereal! Magic Spoon is a brand-new cereal that is low carb, high protein, and zero sugar. It tastes just like your favorite sugary cereal. Each serving has 12g of protein, 3g of net carbs, 0g of sugar, and only 110 calories. Itâ€™s also gluten free, grain free, keto friendly, soy free, and GMO free. And itâ€™s delicious! It comes in your favorite, traditional cereal flavors like Cocoa, Frosted, and Blueberry.

Magic Spoon cereal has received a lot of attention since launching last year. Time magazine included it in their list of Best Inventions of 2019, and Forbes called it â€œthe future of cereal.â€ My listenersâ€”thatâ€™s youâ€”get free shipping and a 100% happiness guarantee when you visit MagicSpoon.com/TIM and use code TIM. 

This episode is also brought to you by â€œ5-Bullet Friday,â€ my very own email newsletter, which every Friday features five bullet points of cool things Iâ€™ve found that week, including apps, books, documentaries, gadgets, albums, articles, TV shows, new hacks or tricks, andâ€”of courseâ€”all sorts of weird stuff Iâ€™ve dug up from around the world. 

Itâ€™s free, itâ€™s always going to be free, and you can subscribe now at tim.blog/friday.

***

If you enjoy the podcast, would you please consider leaving a short review on Apple Podcasts/iTunes? It takes less than 60 seconds, and it really makes a difference in helping to convince hard-to-get guests.

For show notes and past guests, please visit tim.blog/podcast.

Sign up for Timâ€™s email newsletter (â€œ5-Bullet Fridayâ€) at tim.blog/friday.
